intro: Liabum brownei, commonly known as the Brown's liabum, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforest understory. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
